page.title: 01 WOOTTON WAWEN
page.content:
Wootton Wawen is a small village of about 1400 people, situated about 8 miles due west of Warwick, its county town.
It is situated amidst farmland and thus provides few opportunities for work for the inhabitants. Many of the people commute daily to Birmingham, Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwick and other towns for employment.
There is a large Mobile Home Park in the village which caters mainly for elderly and retired people.
Wootton Wawen is a village which, at first sight, seems to offer little of interest. However, it has a history dating back to Saxon times and is worth a detailed study.
